comments:
A java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError is being thrown when attempting to execute an 
application using the SWT libraries.  This applies to at least builds 20011111 
and 20011115.  Stack trace follows:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Unable to load library 
(java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-win32-2014 in java.library.path)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:1902)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Compatibility.loadLibrary
(Compatibility.java:148)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Callback.loadLibrary(Callback.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Callback.<clinit>(Callback.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.TCHAR.<clinit>(TCHAR.java:24)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.<clinit>(Widget.java:78)
	at StyledTextExample.main(StyledTextExample.java:10)
*** Stack trace of contained error ***
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-win32-2014 in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1312)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:749)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:820)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Compatibility.loadLibrary
(Compatibility.java:146)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Callback.loadLibrary(Callback.java:262)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Callback.<clinit>(Callback.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.TCHAR.<clinit>(TCHAR.java:24)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.<clinit>(Widget.java:78)
	at StyledTextExample.main(StyledTextExample.java:10)
Exception in thread "main"

You need to put the DLL somewhere that is visible to the VM you are running. 
If you have the org.eclipse.swt project loaded, it will be in the "ws/win32" 
folder. The simplest thing is to copy it to your "jre/bin" directory.

Note 1: The SWT DLL is matched to the version of SWT that you are running to 
avoid incompatibilities. 

Note 2: Eclipse gets the one it uses via the plugin class loader for the 
org.eclipse.swt plugin (i.e. it's in .../plugins/org.eclipse.swt/win32/swt-
win32-xxxx.dll).
